body_html:
@alanchiao but it is still good idea to run these models with speech_test so that community can try to understand how these models are working on lstm with single input(like OKGOOGLE hotword audio sample run thru network and generate output and matched with golden output.
So please modify speech_test.cc so that we can compile on Linux and run using gdb to step in and understand more about these lstm and svdf float models to detect "okgoogle" hotword.
body_text:
@alanchiao  but it is still good idea to run these models with speech_test so that community can try to understand how these models are working on lstm with single input(like OKGOOGLE hotword audio sample run thru network and generate output and matched with golden output.
So please modify speech_test.cc so that we can compile on Linux and run using gdb to step in and understand more about these lstm and svdf float models to detect "okgoogle" hotword.
body:
@alanchiao  but it is still good idea to run these models with speech_test so that community can try to understand how these models are working on lstm with single input(like OKGOOGLE hotword audio sample run thru network and generate output and matched with golden output.
So please modify speech_test.cc so that we can compile on Linux and run using gdb to step in and understand more about these lstm and svdf float models to detect "okgoogle" hotword.
